Funeral services were held at the First Methodist Church of Riverhead today for Mrs. Robert P. Griffing, former president of the Woman's Club here and prominent for many years in civic affairs.

Draught beer drinkers in New York City last year paid for $10,000,000 worth of beer that they never received because brewers short-measured barrels, it was charged yesterday by Commissioner of Markets William Fellowes Morgan Jr. in announcing a concerted drive to end this practice. Mr.

The German Government announces it has colelected 111,701,113 marks in "escape taxes" during the first half of the current fiscal year, beginning April 1. This compares with only 81,353,000 marks for the entire fiscal year of 1936-37 and less than 1,000,000 marks in 1932, the last year preceding the Hitler regime.

The New York World's Fair explained yesterday that while Venezuela was the fourth South American country to contract for a site for its own pavilion at the fair, all the other republics of Latin America would be represented at the exposition either with their own pavilions or in the Hall of Nations and the Pan American Wing.

With electric ranges at the beginning of this year installed in only 9 per cent of .the 23,000,000 electrified homes in the country, this type of appliance has the largest potential market of any of the major items in the field, according to a survey last week by one of the industry' associations. Excluding radios;

Although practically every maker of women's hosiery has shown interest in the new yarn developed by du Pont, which is expected to become a strong competitor of silk, no manufacturer of half-hose as yet has considered it for men's wear, reports yesterday indicated.

Having experienced a moderate upturn in business since mid-Summer, hotel men are sufficiently hopeful of continued gains to begin spending some money for new supplies and decorations, but they are on no spending spree, according to exhibitors at the National Hotel Exposition, which opened at Grand Central Palace yesterday and will continue through Friday.
William J. Henning of 2024 Greene Ave., Ridgewood, L. I., was found dead in bed here today, victim of a heart attack, Coroner Herbert L. Gaus said. His age was 57.

Preliminary figures indicate that net income of the Atchison, Topeka Santa Fe Railway in September was larger than the total for September, 1937, S. T. Bledsoe, president, said yesterday. He said the decline in freight movement seemed to be slowing up.

Wisconsin Electric Power Company 6 per cent preferred capital stock, $100 par value, has been substituted on the New York Stock Exchange list for Milwaukee Electric Railway and Light Company 6 per cent preferred capital stock, $100 par value.

Espionage report: One of this department's spies brings back the true weights in Pittsburgh's "Dream Backfield" . . . Dick Cassiano, 190 pounds; John Chickerneo, 213; Curly Stebbins, 207, and Mad Marshall Goldberg, 200. And the Panther line averages 203. .. Which brings to mind the Portland University roster that contains the catch-line "Honest weights, no springs."

Miss Ethel Chamberlain, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Francis Chamberlain of Stonesides, Lexington, was married here tonight in the First Unitarian Church to Porter Dietrich, son of Mr. and Mrs. Howard H. Dietrich of Westport, Conn. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Dr. Frederick Gill and the Rev. John Nicol Mark.

The engagement has been announced of Miss Molly Hornsby, elder daughter of Sir Bertram and Lady Hornsby of The Old Rectory in Ifield, near Crawley in Sussex, to William Gardner Miller 3d of New York and Paris, eldest son of Carroll Miller,
The effect of the recent hurricane is reflected in the earnings of the Boston Edison Company for the three months ended on Sept. 30, Frank D. Comerford, president, reported yesterday.

1st Ave, 1,140. 25x81.5; give to secure S2,000 advanced at any time as and for aid to dependent children, Rosario and Antoninette Giani, Antonina or AnnP Gianl. grandmother of dependent children. to City of New York by Board of Child Welfare; due Feb. 27, 1942, without interest: S2,000.

Debits to individual accounts, as reported by banks in leading cities for the week ended Oct. 19, aggregated $9,159,000,000, or 34 per cent above the total reported for the preceding week, which included only five business days in most of the reporting centers, and 12 per cent below the total for the corresponding week of last year.
Young women in society have volunteered to act as manikins in the fashion show to be given in conjunction with a luncheon today at the Versailles for the benefit of the Prosperity Shop. Among them

Trading in wheat futures on the Board of Trade here today was featured by the changing over between the December and May deliveries at 2 cents a bushel premium for the latter. Prices were higher early on
